attic.description:
You've just sauntered into an attic. You begin to take stock of what's here.

 As if things weren't amazing enough already, you can even see a cabinet. Classic TextWorld.[if c_0 is open and there is something in the c_0] The cabinet contains [a list of things in the c_0].[end if][if c_0 is open and the c_0 contains nothing] Empty! What kind of nightmare TextWorld is this?[end if]

 There is [if d_0 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] gate leading east. You need an unguarded exit? You should try going north. There is an unguarded exit to the west.

sauna.description:
You've walked into an ordinary room. Your mind races to think of what kind of room would be ordinary. And then it hits you. Of course. You're in the sauna.

 [if c_1 is locked]A locked[else if c_1 is open]An open[otherwise]A closed[end if] dresser, which looks normal, is here.[if c_1 is open and there is something in the c_1] The dresser contains [a list of things in the c_1].[end if][if c_1 is open and the c_1 contains nothing] The dresser is empty! This is the worst thing that could possibly happen, ever![end if] You see a trunk. You wonder idly who left that here.[if c_2 is open and there is something in the c_2] The trunk contains [a list of things in the c_2]. You wonder idly who left that here.[end if][if c_2 is open and the c_2 contains nothing] The trunk is empty! What a waste of a day![end if] You can make out a rack. [if there is something on the s_0]On the rack you make out [a list of things on the s_0].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_0]However, the rack, like an empty rack, has nothing on it.[end if]

There is an unblocked exit to the east. There is an unblocked exit to the north.

cubicle.description:
You've entered a cubicle.



There is an unguarded exit to the north. You need an unguarded exit? You should try going south. There is an unguarded exit to the west.

garage.description:
You find yourself in a garage. An usual one. The room is well lit.

 You can make out [if c_3 is locked]a locked[else if c_3 is open]an opened[otherwise]a closed[end if] safe.[if c_3 is open and there is something in the c_3] The safe contains [a list of things in the c_3].[end if][if c_3 is open and the c_3 contains nothing] The safe is empty! This is the worst thing that could possibly happen, ever![end if]

There is an unguarded exit to the east. You need an unblocked exit? You should try going north. There is an exit to the south. Don't worry, it is unguarded.

playroom.description:
You find yourself in a playroom. A normal kind of place.

 You lean against the wall, inadvertently pressing a secret button. The wall opens up to reveal a coffer.[if c_4 is open and there is something in the c_4] The coffer contains [a list of things in the c_4].[end if][if c_4 is open and the c_4 contains nothing] The coffer is empty! This is the worst thing that could possibly happen, ever![end if]

You need an unblocked exit? You should try going south. There is an unguarded exit to the west.

steam room.description:
You've entered a steam room.



There is an exit to the east. Don't worry, it is unguarded. You don't like doors? Why not try going south, that entranceway is unguarded.

study.description:
You are in a study. A typical one. The room is well lit.

 You see a bureau.[if c_5 is open and there is something in the c_5] The bureau contains [a list of things in the c_5].[end if][if c_5 is open and the c_5 contains nothing] The bureau is empty! What a waste of a day![end if] You see a desk. The desk is ordinary.[if there is something on the s_1] On the desk you can see [a list of things on the s_1]. Suddenly, you bump your head on the ceiling, but it's not such a bad bump that it's going to prevent you from looking at objects and even things.[end if][if there is nothing on the s_1] But the thing is empty. What, you think everything in TextWorld should have stuff on it?[end if] You can make out a mantle. The mantle is normal.[if there is something on the s_2] On the mantle you make out [a list of things on the s_2].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_2] But the thing hasn't got anything on it. Hm. Oh well[end if]

 There is [if d_0 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] gate leading west. You don't like doors? Why not try going east, that entranceway is unguarded.

chamber.description:
You've entered a chamber.

 As if things weren't amazing enough already, you can even see a bar. [if there is something on the s_3]You see [a list of things on the s_3] on the bar, so there's that.[end if][if there is nothing on the s_3]The bar appears to be empty. Hm. Oh well[end if]

You need an unguarded exit? You should try going west.

canteen.description:
You've just sauntered into a canteen. You try to gain information on your surroundings by using a technique you call 'looking.'



There is an unguarded exit to the north. There is an unblocked exit to the south.

pantry.description:
You find yourself in a pantry. You decide to start listing off everything you see in the room, as if you were in a text adventure.



You need an unblocked exit? You should try going north. There is an unguarded exit to the south.
